string.text: I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new special task for me, General?

Yes, there is no shortage of work to do in our line of duty. Our forward reconnaissance team detected unidentified radio transmissions in the area of the Iron Forest anomaly in Zaton. They have not got the necessary equipment to decrypt them, however, so I want you to investigate.
Understood.
I apologise commander, I'm not ready right now.
Excellent. Take this radio; our technicians have modified it appropriately. Report on your findings as soon as possible. Who knows what is going on so close to the CNPP.
I'm back from Zaton.
Did you hear anything interesting?

Yes, General. I was briefly involved in a military operation led by Colonel Degtyarev. Seems a group of foreign special agents called UNISG has been investigating recent events in the Zone. The army doesn't want them to discover too much.
Nothing in particular, commander. Just meaningless noise.
I see. This is a very intriguing discovery indeed. We will observe the region more closely for further developments. Meanwhile, you are free to resume your usual activities. Dismissed.
Thank you for confirming. Well, there is nothing more I require of you right now, so you are free to resume your usual activities. Dismissed.
Understood.
I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new special contract for me?

Yes, of course. Work is what we do. Our team in Zaton intercepted intermittent radio transmissions from around the Iron Forest in Zaton. Thing is, all they heard was jumbled noise. I want you to go there and check what's going on with proper equipment.
Sure thing.
Sorry Dushman, I've got another contract to complete right now.
Very well, info is worth money, too. Take this radio, Hog outfitted it with an advanced decryption device. Come back when you find out anything.
I'm back from Zaton.
Heard anything interesting?

Yes, actually. One Colonel Degtyarev hired me to help in a black ops mission. They've been trying to keep a group of very curious foreigners called UNISG from finding out too much about the Zone's dirty secrets.
No, not really. Just some static, nothing special.

The UN is here already? One of their scouts was supposed to pick up some info from me on their way in, but they never made it. I guess we now know why, since it sounds like they got discovered pretty early. If the UN requests our services, I'll help them out. That said, what you do is up to you... thanks to the immense intrigue among western corporate and government powers, we actually stand to profit either way.
Some leads turn out false, it seems. Ah well, I'm sure you've got more interesting contracts to get back to now.
Very well. See you.
I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new job for me?

Always eager to earn more money, eh, stalker? Yes, there's a thing that's popped up recently. I found out through Beard that stalkers have been talking about some weird radio noise they pick up in the Iron Forest in Zaton. Might be the anomalies doing their thing, might be something interesting. Go check it out, will ya?
Sure thing, Sid. Just sit tight as I casually walk across the entire Zone for the nth time.
Sorry Sid, I'm not ready right now.
That's my boy. Take this here radio with you, unless you want to pick up the transmissions with a metal inlay in your teeth or something. Come back if you discover anything worthwhile.
I'm back from Zaton.
Heard anything interesting, stalker?

Yes, very interesting. See, a man called Colonel Degtyarev has been carrying out top secret operations in the centre of the Zone. He fights a group called UNISG, a foreign task force who're trying to uncover the Zone's dirty laundry.
Not really. I sure made a long trip to listen to some static, though.
That's great news, stalker. As you already know, information is worth a lot of money, especially if it's top secret. I'll see what I can do with this, hehe. Anyway, you can go do your thing now.
Ah shit, I kind of expected this to be another made-up stalker story. Anyway, you can go do your thing now.
See ya.
I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new special job for me?

Yes, there's a little something you could research. I heard through our Ecologist contacts that there've been some rather mysterious radio transmissions occurring in the Iron Forest in Zaton. I know, I know, it's just like the Swamp but on the other side of the Zone. Still, I think it's worth looking into considering that the CNPP is so close to that place.
Sounds interesting, count me in.
Sorry Cold, I can't make yet another trip like that just yet. Not so soon.
Another adventure for you, hehe. By the way, take this little thingy from Novikov, it'll decrypt any radio transmission you might intercept over there. Good hunting.
I'm back from Zaton.
Heard anything interesting?

Sure. I overheard a military transmission and joined a guy called Colonel Degtyarev in a black ops mission. They wanted to get rid of a team sent by a foreign group named UNISG, who've been investigating the Zone a bit too thoroughly for the SSU's liking.
Not really. Just some anomalous static, not much else.

Look what we've got there. Quite interesting indeed. Well, I hope you liked playing a secret agent for a while. You didn't get a bullet in the back of the head as a reward, so that's nice. Take a moment to unwind now, I'll see what I can do with this piece of info.
Ah well, I doubt even Kalancha would be interested in that. Thanks for trying, I suppose. You can go now.
See you, Cold.
I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new adventure for me?

You just can't sit in one place for too long, eh? I like that adventurous spark in you, mate. So, Loki told me there's been a whole lotta new noise near the Iron Forest in Zaton. Might be the anomalies making sounds, might be top secret radio comms between Spetsnaz units or something. Go check 'em out.
Great, count me in!
Sorry Lukash, I need to recover from my hangover first.
That's the spirit. Ah, right, take this radio. You haven't got a metal plate in your head, I bet, so this should come in handy. Lemme know if you find anything interesting.
I'm back from Zaton.
Heard anything interesting over there?

Oh man, you wouldn't believe! I got involved in a top secret military operation of all things! A guy called Degtyarev wanted us to get rid of a bunch of UNISG agents. They're some sorta international task force who've been investigating the Zone. The army doesn't like that, of course.
Nah, not really. Listened to static from anomalies, got bored and came back here.

Hah, two government-backed forces duking it out with each other over who owns the Zone's secrets? That's hilarious! Good to hear Degtyarev is still kicking. The army are all bastards, no mistake, but that guy is one glorious bastard. If you see him around, tell him to take a break and give Yanov another hand, alright? I hear it gets rougher up there every day.

Well, listening to the song of the Zone might be fun too, eh? No? Okay, nevermind. Go do something more interesting, I don't want you to get bored to death. Now that would be a way to croak in the Zone...
See ya, man.
I've received the message about the mysterious radio transmissions. Have you got any new important assignment for me?

Oh, yes, young man. Do you know Professor Hermann? His bunker up north reported some intriguing radio transmissions occurring in the Iron Forest in Zaton. This is especially interesting considering the prominent anomalous activity in that area. I would like you to conduct research at that location, there's no telling what we might discover.
I'll go at once, Professor.
I apologise Professor, I'm not ready for such a long trip right now.
Thank you. Here, take this device with you. It will attempt to decrypt and record anything you might intercept. I wish you good luck.
I'm back from Zaton.
Did you discover anything interesting, young man?

Yes, Professor. I overheard a military radio transmission and was temporarily drafted into a top secret mission by Colonel Degtyarev. We fought a task force sent by UNISG, foreign special agents who have been investigating the Zone's deepest secrets.
Not really, Professor. Just some static from the local anomalies.

Oh, I see. While researching the Zone itself and its many marvellous phenomena is worthwhile indeed, I could only shudder at the consequences of information pertaining to its creation falling into the wrong hands. Thank you, young man, you can go now.
What a bother. It seems I'll have to reject Hermann's hypothesis.
Good bye, Professor.
My... head... my... head...
Hey, tough guy.
Hey, Rogue. You still handy with your toolkit?
What... what are you doing, mate?
My... head... fucking... psy-anomaly... need... pills... need... a... pill...
Oh shit. Just hold on here a little longer, I'll find something!
Snap out of it, man! Fight it off!
Argh... help... me...
For fuck's sake, keep it together!
Stop... yelling... I m-must... mmm... mmm... MONOLITH!
Fuck!
I've got a pill, take it!
Th-thank you man, they almost got me.
What happened?

Urgh... our team got separated fighting some Monolith soldiers. I was slowly retreating, laying down suppressive fire to keep the fanatics at bay... accidentally stepped into a psy-anomaly, all those voices started whispering in my head. The Monolith fucks simply picked me up, dragged me here and left. I think they wanted to convert me. I'd rather jump into an anomaly... any other anomaly. Fuck.
What happened to your psy-helmet?
Damn thing always made my teeth itch. With the Scorcher down, I didn't think I'd need it. Shows what I know. Anyway, let's go to the laundromat. We need to regroup.
Let's go.
Here we are.
Thank you, tough guy. You saved me from a fate worse than death. I won't forget that.
You're welcome, Rogue.
We've got to hurry, let's go.
I've got a bad feeling about this.
Hey there, Strelok. Killing off the Monolith as usual, I see?
Thank you, I didn't expect you would come. This place isn't safe. Let's go to the laundromat, we need to talk.
Let's move.
What happened? Where are the others?

We'd been cutting off Monolith supply lines in order to starve them out. Eventually, they assembled a squad to deal with us. We were separated during the battle. It's dangerous to send long-range messages in this area, and I'm too fatigued after all this to look for Rogue and Stitch in person. We split up close to the abandoned hospital, they couldn't have gone too far. Look around the area, try to find them.
Sure thing, you stay here. I'll bring them back.
I found Rogue in a kindergarten, praying to a weird statue. He succumbed to a psy-anomaly.
Damn it. He used to boast that nothing in the Zone could kill him. Neither mutants nor the Monolith... only to get his head fried by an anomaly. May he rest in peace.
Agreed.
I found Stitch near the Prometheus Movie Theatre, besieged by a horde of zombies. He wasn't able to make it.
The Zone will be a much darker place without him. May he rest in peace.
Agreed.
Pripyat is deadly as usual.
Yes. Fortunately, the whole team pulled through. I'd rather not bury my companions again.
Rogue was tough as nails. Stitch and I will struggle without his steadfast support in battle.
Stitch was a great companion. Rogue and I will struggle without his sense of humour.
Almost all my friends, lost to the Zone... yet again. What will it take from me next? I don't think there's much left at this point.
No problem, Strelok. I kind of feel like a part of the team myself, glad I could help.
I didn't expect Rogue to die, especially not in an actual battle. Damn it.
Stitch was such a cheerful guy, it feels wrong that he died. Damn it.
The Zone is ruthless, alright. To think they simply died after all they'd been through... a grim reminder of what we're dealing with.

No choice but to move on. Even after the death of the C-Consciousness, the crippling blows we dealt to the Monolith and Sin, and deactivation of all the psy-installations... the Zone persists. I wonder if we're actually capable of destroying its horrors for good at all.
I think the Zone is here to stay, for better or worse.
Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're a member of Duty so you can't simply leave, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.

Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're a mercenary and might not be comfortable breaking your contract with Dushman, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.
Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're a free stalker so you might prefer independence, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.
Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're a member of Clear Sky so you obviously might not want to, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.

Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're a member of Freedom so you might disagree with my conviction, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.
Perhaps. We'll think what to do next after we get some rest. I realise you're an Ecologist so you can't simply leave, but consider joining us. We'll need all the help we can get.
Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're a member of Duty so you can't simply leave, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.

Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're a mercenary and might not be comfortable breaking your contract with Dushman, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.
Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're a free stalker so you might prefer independence, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.
Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're a member of Clear Sky so you obviously might not want to, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.
Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're a member of Freedom so you might disagree with my conviction, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.
Perhaps. I'll think what to do next. I realise you're an Ecologist so you can't simply leave, but consider joining me. My team is gone, and I'll need all the help I can get.
Alright, Strelok, I'll consider it.
Sorry Strelok, but I can't abandon my other commitments. Farewell.
Fair enough. See you around.
Colonel Degtyarev, the SSU agent standing outside, has orders to either take you back under government custody or... eliminate you.

I'm not keen on working with the military any more. When they inevitably break something they prefer to pretend nothing's happened, and keep it a closely guarded secret. Fixing things is simply too much effort and a waste of money, consequences be damned.
I know, Strelok, but hear me out.
Yes?
I've earned Degtyarev's trust. We might be able to take his men by surprise if we strike hard and fast. I don't really want to do this, but I'm not letting them capture you.

Given how successful the rest of the operation was, Degtyarev has leeway to compromise. If you agree to go into hiding and keep your knowledge of the Zone to yourself from now on, he'll let you go. I'll stick up for you if he goes back on his word.

Given how successful the rest of his operation was, Degtyarev has leeway to compromise. If you agree to go into hiding and keep your knowledge of the Zone to yourself from now on, he'll let you go. I'll stick up for you if he goes back on his word.

Given how successful the rest of his operation was, Degtyarev has leeway to compromise. If you agree to go into hiding and keep your knowledge of the Zone to yourself from now on, he'll let you go. I'll stick up for you if he goes back on his word.
So be it. This is what it has come to. Let us end this, then.
That's more or less what I was going to do anyway. Let's tell him I agree.
Okay, let's do this. Follow me.
Well, the Colonel is dead. This should slow the Military's pursuit of you for a while at least.
He was a decent man. I doubt the military will continue the mission without him. Thank you for standing up for me.
Too bad it had come to this, but at least we could count on you again. Thank you.
After everything we've faced off together? It's the least I can do.

Yes, we really have been through a lot together, haven't we? I'm glad for the journey, although I'm sad it's drawing to a close. I'll need to go into hiding once again, try find a base that half the Zone doesn't know about. We likely won't see each other for a long, long time. Maybe I'll finally pay Doctor a visit, take him with me. Who knows? Still, goodbye... and see you.
Farewell, Strelok.
Seems that after all that the army guys will let you go scot-free.
This could've gone very differently, but I had a feeling Degtyarev would come around. Still, this is a real relief.
Yes, I'm glad. I wish the whole group was alive to see this outcome. Still, this is probably the best we could've hoped for.
Yes, I'm glad. I wish the whole group was alive to see this outcome. Still, this is probably the best we could've hoped for.
It's terrible that Stitch and Rogue died so close to reaching a peaceful resolution. I'll have to find time to bury them alongside Fang and Ghost.
Yeah, the situation was volatile. Glad I could help defuse it.
I'm sure they'll come to be remembered as legends too, Strelok.

We should get going now. We need to find a new hideout, one that half the Zone doesn't already know about. We've been through a lot together, you and I. I'm glad for the journey, although I'm sad it's drawing to a close. Maybe I'll finally pay Doctor a visit. I'm sure he'd like to meet my new team, but after that... well, the Zone only knows. I do not know if I was wrong or right, but we all made it... and I guess I'm thankful for that. Farewell.

Stitch and I should get going now. We need to find a new hideout, one that half the Zone doesn't already know about. We've been through a lot together, you and I. I'm glad for the journey, although I'm sad it's drawing to a close, and that not all of us made it to the end. Maybe I'll finally pay Doctor a visit. I'm sure he'd like to meet Stitch, they have a lot in common, but after that... well, the Zone only knows. I do not know if I was wrong or right, but we made it... and I guess I'm thankful for that. Farewell.

Rogue and I should get going now. We need to find a new hideout, one that half the Zone doesn't already know about. We've been through a lot together, you and I. I'm glad for the journey, although I'm sad it's drawing to a close, and that not all of us made it to the end. Maybe I'll finally pay Doctor a visit. I'm sure he'd like to meet Rogue, but after that... well, the Zone only knows. I do not know if I was wrong or right, but we made it... and I guess I'm thankful for that. Farewell.

I should get going now. I need to find a new hideout, one that half the Zone doesn't already know about. We've been through a lot together, you and I. I'm glad for the journey, although I'm sad it's drawing to a close, and that neither of my new companions made it to the end. Maybe I'll finally pay Doctor a visit. It'll be good to see one of my few surviving friends again, but after that... well, the Zone only knows. I do not know if I was wrong or right, but I made it... and I guess I'm thankful for that. Farewell.
Hopefully we'll see each other again soon. Until next time, Strelok.
That was rough. How the hell did you end up like this?

So, we were fighting a large group of Monolith guys. Things went pretty hectic fast, bullets flying everywhere, grenades blowing up, Monolith fighters yelling their nonsense... I fled to the theatre to catch a breath. Only to realise it was full of friggin' zombies. I skedaddled the hell out of there... and then I ran into another bunch of zombies. Good thing you came, I kinda ran out of options... Can we go to the laundromat now? Please?
Sure thing. Let's go.
We made it. You didn't get bitten, right? Not sure who'd treat the medic for infections.
Ha! I'd laugh my ass off if I wasn't still shaking... phew. Thanks for the help, man, I owe you one.
You're welcome, Stitch.
We've got to hurry, let's go.
Sure man, let's do this!
We're on a tight schedule here, so let's make this quick.
Hello there.
Oh, it's you. You'd best not involve yourself any further.
Who are you?

That's my line, stalker. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. I hope I can rely on you as a member of Duty.

That's my line, merc. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. Of course, you'll be adequately rewarded.

That's my line, stalker. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. Of course, you'll be adequately rewarded.

That's my line, stalker. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. As a member of Clear Sky, you likely understand that some secrets are best kept hidden.

That's my line, stalker. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. I know that Freedom isn't fond of the military, although this way you could repay the debt for my assistance to your faction in Yanov.

That's my line. Seems we've attracted some unwanted attention. Anyway, I'm Colonel Degtyarev. There's no time to waste, so I've got an offer you can't refuse: come and help my unit eliminate an enemy squad. I realise that you're probably here to conduct some sort of research, but you've more than proven your mettle against Sin, and any assistance we can get is appreciated.
Alright, I'll help you out.
I'd rather not get involved in this.
Good. The enemy's currently stationed in an abandoned ranger station to the south-east. Take point, my unit and I will be right behind you.
You're already involved in this, so I'm afraid you're in no position to refuse. I may neglect to mention that you stumbled upon us when I report back to my superiors, if you help us. Consider this.
Okay, Colonel. Let's go.
Fine, you've made your point. I'll help out the devil I know.
We've got them all. What happens now?
We've just dealt with the sentries they left behind. Let's wait for the rest of the team here, they should be returning from recon in a few.
How many?
Nine well-armed soldiers. Their commander has got an exoskeleton, so make ready for a tough fight.
Let's hope they don't realise anything is up until it's too late.
Now we've got them all. Anything else?
Search the bodies. Their captain will have a PDA on him, I'd like to take a look at it.
Sure thing.
Here, I've found the captain's PDA.
Good, hand it to me. This'll help us predict their next movement.
Who exactly are these people?
You read the patches on their uniforms, didn't you?
Yeah, it says "UNISG", but if those were scientists then I'm a Burer.

Perhaps they were back in 2011, when they were first founded. But given all the recent chaos, the war with Sin, the giant emission from a while ago... seems the United Nations felt the need to reorganise them into a special reconnaissance task force. The scouts I captured still claim to study the Zone just like the Ecologists, but we know they're very curious about its origin, too. Something which best remains a mystery for now.
Wow, you actually told me. Is this the point where I get shot in the back of the head?

Don't worry. This isn't the first time I've worked with the locals, so to speak. I appreciate your assistance, so you'll receive a commission from me for your service here. And I'll keep your involvement a secret. But, I'll give you a friendly warning: keep the secrets you've uncovered to yourself, including this operation. The less you talk the less likely it is that we'll have to come for you one day.
Fair enough, I get it. Farewell, Colonel.
Can't say I expected you here. What are you doing in Yanov?
Just visiting. You know, exploring, hunting the most dangerous game, this kind of thing.
Are you sure other stalkers won't mind?
Of course not. In fact, it seems that I'm quite fondly remembered by the local community as a helpful neutral stalker. And I hope it will stay that way.
Yeah, sure. But why did you send me a message? I didn't think you'd need a travelling companion.

You see, I am a busy man. There are many things I have to take care of at the same time. You've accomplished much during your time in the Zone. Any assistance you'd lend would be highly appreciated, and rewarded.
What do you need?

I need a package delivered to one of my friends. He'll be waiting not far from here. Thing is, he told me that he's been pursued by a team of "thugs". Like the ones you and I fought recently. So, the delivery must be quick and furtive. Are you in?
Yes, I'll do it.
Come back when you're done.
About the delivery...
What is it, stalker?
I trust a professional like you isn't having too much trouble?
Nothing, nevermind.
I brought the package to your, uhm, friend.
Your friend got caught. He was dead by the time I arrived.
Sorry, I wasn't able to deliver the case on time.

Excellent, here's your reward. And another task for you. You see, another friend of mine managed to infiltrate a squad of "thugs". He's been observing their criminal actions for a while now. Contact him directly and take a pendrive with intel from him.
And what about the rest of the "thugs" your friend will be with? Won't they shoot me on sight?

Given the circumstances they are in, this particular group should be fine with you as long as you go alone and don't let them catch on to why you're really there. By the way, my friend will ask you about dangerous mutants in the area. Remember to tell him that you were attacked by a pack of blind dogs on your way.
Okay, I'm on it.

Shit, this is bad. I'll have to devise another plan to have the package delivered. I suppose you deserve a small reward for trying regardless, I need you motivated for the next task. You see, another friend of mine managed to infiltrate a squad of "thugs". He's been observing their criminal actions for a while now. Contact him directly and take a pendrive with intel from him.
About your friend...
Yes?
Nothing, nevermind.
I have the pendrive. They didn't suspect anything.
I have the pendrive. Unfortunately, I messed up the spy-talk so things got heated.

Good job. I'm almost done in this sector. There's one more thing: seems that the "thugs" have been thoroughly searching the old Jupiter factory. I don't want them to find anything confidential in case there's something still left, so we should dispose of them. Better safe than sorry.
Fair enough, let's go.

You... dammit man, it was a simple pass-phrase! I expected more of someone with your resume. Still, we might find some use for the info that you've brought. I'm almost done in this sector. There's one more thing: seems that the "thugs" have been thoroughly searching the old Jupiter factory. I don't want them to find anything confidential in case there's something still left, so we should dispose of them. Better safe than sorry.
Well, the pile of bones just keeps getting bigger. Are we done yet?
The immediate threat is gone. Now we should search the factory to find any remaining documents. I visited this place a few years ago, but I might have missed a spot. Those were busy times.
Alright. Watch me become a bloody digger.
Here, take the documents.

Very well, we're done in Jupiter. It's time for me to leave now, Operation Afterglow is still ongoing. There's a situation on the outskirts of Pripyat I have to handle, but there's no need to get you involved. Thanks for the help. See you around.
See you, Colonel.
We're too late. If anything was here, it's being poured over by UNISG researchers as we speak. What now?

My job gets harder now, that's what. Still, we're done in Jupiter. It's time for me to leave now, I have to salvage the operation. There's a situation on the outskirts of Pripyat I have to handle, but your time assisting me is over. See you.
See you, Degtyarev.
What's going on here, Colonel?

It can be easy to forget, but I'm an officer of the Security Service of Ukraine, and I have orders. The Zone has got many secrets that best remain hidden. However, some people have already discovered far too much for comfort. Strelok is one of those people, and the UNISG know this. My main objective is to prevent sensitive information from leaking into the wrong hands. My current orders are to bring Strelok back under government custody to resume working as our official research advisor... or to terminate him.
Are you seriously trying to apprehend Strelok? He's one of the most experienced stalkers in the Zone. That guy has been fighting the Monolith, and winning, for several years!

Operation Afterglow has been a severe disappointment so far. UNISG have already discovered almost enough to justify a joint international annexation of the Zone. Situation's FUBAR, and the least we can do is some damage control to salvage the operation. We can't let anyone else speak with Strelok. This includes you.

Operation Afterglow has been a great success so far. We were able to guard all of our secrets from the UNISG, and they'll likely be forced to rapidly demilitarise within the Zone, if not leave entirely. Situation's stable, and all that's left is to tie up loose ends and wrap up the operation. As such, we can't let anyone else speak with Strelok.

Operation Afterglow has been a disappointment so far. UNISG has learned enough to secure additional funding and support from the UN. Situation's serious, and we mustn't fail any more to salvage the operation. We can't let anyone else speak with Strelok. This includes you.

Operation Afterglow has been a success so far. While UNISG discovered a little, it won't be enough to justify their upkeep for more than a year or two. Situation's favourable, and we should tie up loose ends to wrap up the operation. We can't let anyone else speak with Strelok.
I'm sorry I wasn't of much help. Still, is this really necessary?
I'm glad I could help you accomplish so much. Is there any chance I could ask for a favour in return?
It's not that bad, you don't have to do this!
I'm glad I could help you a little in accomplishing that. Is there any chance I could ask for a favour in return?
Yes, absolutely. I'm afraid I require your full cooperation unless you want to be "swept under the rug" as well.
This is a military operation, although you did contribute significantly to its success. What kind of "favour" do you have in mind?
Actually, I do. I hope you'll cooperate, I don't want you to be "swept under the rug" as well.
This is a military operation, and I'm not sure I have enough leeway to be granting any "favours"... but try me.
Well, shit. I suppose I've got no choice.
I'm sick of this shit, Degtyarev. Time to put you down, like I should've at the beginning.
I think we both know that Strelok won't want to come quietly. Let me try convince him to work out a compromise instead: he goes into hiding along with his secrets in exchange for you letting him go.

That sounds like a reasonable favour. The brass won't like it, but I think we have enough leeway to afford letting him 'get away', given the overall success of the operation. Alright. I'll give you ten minutes to work things out.
Thanks, Colonel. This would be the best outcome for everyone.
You've got it your way. Strelok won't reveal any secrets ever again.

This wasn't the best solution, but we had little choice. At least now Operation Afterglow isn't a complete failure... and you can leave in one piece, as long as you swear to keep your own mouth shut. Remember, we'll be watching you.

This wasn't the best solution, but if it works, it works... At least we can now say Operation Afterglow was somewhat successful. In recognition of your moderate contribution, I can let you go as long as you swear to keep your own mouth shut. Remember, we'll be watching you.
I only agreed to this to keep you and your tin soldier boys off my ass. I certainly won't tell anyone what I found out about the Zone. That's a promise.
Very well. No offence, but I hope we won't meet again.
Very well. We probably won't meet again, but I'm sure that suits you just fine.
Bye, Colonel.
One more UNISG squad dead, and no need for more violence. Strelok will make sure they won't find him.
Solid job, if I do say so myself. Strelok can leave, we won't pursue him any more. So can you.
Good work. We'll let Strelok leave, although we'll keep an eye on him. Same about you.
Fair enough. It was quite nice working with you, Colonel.
Once again, excellent work. We might cooperate again some day. Until then.
You performed fairly well. You're free to go and resume your usual activities. Goodbye.
See you, Colonel.
Yes? What do you want?
I've got a package from Colonel Degtyarev for you.
Alright, hand it to me.
Is that all?
Yes, there's no time to waste. You can go now.
Have a good trip.
What are you doing here, stalker? Camp's a little tense today, best to stay away if you don't want trouble.
I'm just a messenger. A mutual contact wanted me to inform you about mutant activity in the area.
Ah, fine. So, how was the trip? Anything dangerous around?
I was attacked by a pack of blind dogs on my way here.
Actually, I was attacked by a pack of blind dogs on my way here.
I was attacked by a pack of pseudodogs on my way here.
I was attacked by a pseudogiant on my way here.
Uh, are you sure about that?
Shit, you idiot! Take this and leave right now!
Mhm, right. We'll watch out for them, thanks. Take this and go right now.
Bye.
Well, shit.
Yet another mission in the Zone...
We're moving out, let's go.
To think that stalker helped us out a few years ago. Well, orders are orders.
